III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was not required or requested.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
2

• Consultation was provided pertaining to R.400.4136, Recreational activities.
Youth interviewed reported they feel like there are not enough indoor activities.
Schedules do display recreational activities on the schedules. There are specific
recreational activities such as, "salon," but there are time frames that state,
"indoor/outdoor" activities. It was suggested to discuss with the teams what they
are actually planning for that date to ensure there are activities planned and then
follow up to see if those plans were completed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There have been no incidents of maltreatment in care this reporting period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
There was one Corrective Action Plan (CAP) during this reporting period. The CAP
was in response to special investigation 2025SIC0000311; CAP approved on
3/3/25. The corrective action plan has not been fully completed at this time. The
agency was in violation of R.400.4159. The agency has coached the staff and
reviewed the video footage with him. There have been no other investigations in
this area since this incident.
Financial Overview
Not applicable.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was completed. Children's Village reviews
policies, procedures, and youth case files on an on-going basis. Annual training is
completed and this past year they added a Training and Development Specialist.
All physical managements have been reviewed with administration and camera
footage if available. Children's Village is working toward PREA certification and is in
compliance with PREA standards.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted and there are no concerns noted. Staff interviewed
reported they enjoyed their jobs and felt like they were impacting the youth.
Youth interviewed reported they liked the staff and felt that they were well taken
care of at the facility. Youth did report they felt a lack of indoor activities were being
completed. This was addressed in consultation.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Facility is well maintained and in good condition. There are no concerns.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
